reasoning: Breaking change detected in payments schema.
Human approval required by policy.

human_feedback.notes: Approved after migration plan was attached.

reasoning: Detected multiple breaking changes in the payment system, triggering the 'payments_breaking_change' policy rule.
Property 'amount' changed from 'number' to 'PaymentAmount' object, which will cause immediate runtime failures in downstream consumers like OrderService.
Renaming 'userId' to 'customerId' across Payment and PaymentMethod schemas breaks existing data contracts.
Public API 'api/payments.ts' is impacted, requiring coordinated migration for external clients.
Status enum values were modified, which may break business logic and reporting systems relying on the old values ('pending', 'completed').
Triggered 'payments_breaking_change' policy requiring human approval for the payment system.
Critical risk identified for public API 'api/payments.ts' which requires external client migration.
Fundamental shift in data structure for 'amount' will break all downstream financial calculations until migrated.
Significant enum changes ('status' and 'type') will break existing business logic in OrderService.
Mandatory escalation triggered by 'payments_breaking_change' policy.
Critical risk identified for public API 'api/payments.ts' affecting external integrations.
Fundamental data type change for 'amount' (number -> object) will break 'OrderService' and 'PaymentService'.
Precedent suggests human review is required to validate the migration plan for major version (v2.0) payment upgrades.
Triggered 'payments_breaking_change' policy requiring human sign-off for v2.0 schema evolution.
Critical risk identified for public-facing 'api/payments.ts'; structural changes to 'amount' will break all legacy integrations.
Renaming 'userId' to 'customerId' and making 'idempotencyKey' required are significant contract shifts requiring manual verification of the migration guide.
Stated intent for multi-currency support is valid, but the blast radius covers the entire Order-to-Payment flow.
Triggered 'payments_breaking_change' policy requiring human sign-off.
Critical blast radius identified for public-facing API 'api/payments.ts'.

The change introduces 'stop-the-world' breaking changes, including new required fields (idempotencyKey) and structural type changes (amount: number -> object).
Human review is required to validate if the current migration plan satisfies the concerns raised in the previous blocked attempt.
Triggered 'payments_breaking_change' policy.
The last two identical attempts (local-1768665544488, local-1768665821858) were manually blocked by human reviewers.
Introduction of 'stop-the-world' breaking changes (required idempotencyKey and amount type shift) creates unacceptable risk for the public API.
Current migration plan does not address previous feedback regarding backward compatibility during the v1 to v2 transition.
Triggered 'payments_breaking_change' policy rule.
Clear precedent: Three identical recent attempts were blocked by humans or Dotto-AI due to unacceptable risk to public APIs.
